abstract: The American International Group, the nation’s largest insurance group before it collapsed in 2008, has agreed to pay $725 million to three Ohio pension funds to settle claims of widespread fraud.
snippet: The American International Group, the nation’s largest insurance group before it collapsed in 2008, has agreed to pay $725 million to three Ohio pension funds to settle claims of widespread fraud.
lead_paragraph: 6:52 p.m. | Updated The American International Group, the nation’s largest insurance group before it collapsed in 2008, has agreed to pay $725 million to three Ohio pension funds to settle claims of widespread fraud, The New York Times’s Michael Powell and Mary Williams Walsh report.

headline.main: A.I.G. to Pay $725 Million to Resolve Fraud Claims
